result.execSummary:
The defendant Gina M Makurat was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Certification of SENTENCING HEARING transcript commencing MARCH 18, 2015, received and filed. (20 Pages)  Copy of transcript forwarded to:  INSTITUTION.  jm

Certification of SENTENCING HEARING transcript commencing MARCH 18, 2015 received and filed. (19 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Gina M Makurat in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Gina M Makurat in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   The Court imposed the following sentence:

Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be 2 years concurrent to any other sentence.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for one (1) year.  Defendant shall serve one (1)  year on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.    The defendant  IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  The Court advised the defendant of her determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form CR-234.  Copy provided to defendant.
 * Provide a DNA sample if not previously taken.
 * Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.


Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, defendant Gina M Makurat not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned to 3/18/15 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, defendant Gina M Makurat not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another date.  File retained in court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Parties request another date.  Case is rescheduled for sentencing before Branch 20 on 2/19/15 at 8:30 a.m.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, filed.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

Defendant Gina M Makurat in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Gina M Makurat in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

/submitted by the State, received and filed.  Defendant now charged with the following:
Operating Vehicle Without Owner's Consent (Take and Drive), a Class H Felony, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 943.23(2).

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, defendant Gina M Makurat not in court, in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial; defense counsel was in other court.  Case is adjourned for plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, defendant Gina M Makurat not in court, in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request that the jury trial be converted to a plea date; so ordered by the Court.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/for Prompt Disposition, received and filed.  Case must be heard on or before 12/08/14.
/of Alibi, received and filed.

Attorney Debra J Patterson in court, defendant Gina M Makurat not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As the jury trial was rescheduled to later in September, parties request another final pretrial date.  Case is continued before Branch 20.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Debra J Patterson in court, defendant Gina M Makurat not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a new trial date.  State did not object.  Case is rescheduled for jury trial before Branch 20; the jury trial date of 9/08/14 has been vacated.  Jury trial scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, defendant Gina M Makurat not in court, in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance and requested a trial date; trial date set further out, as defense counsel and the deputies advise the State and the Court that defendant has a pending revocation hearing, as well as three VOP holds.  Court advised the parties that all motions in limine, witness lists and jury instructions are to be filed one week prior to the final pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gina M Makurat in court with Patricia Fritz, student intern under the supervision of attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Gina M Makurat in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Andrew Tischer-MPD Sargeant.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Defendant is requesting a speedy trial demand, however has other holds pending.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nicole T. and the address of 3866 N. Port Washington Rd., Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Gina M Makurat in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Gina M Makurat in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
